content:
The Act may be cited as the "Christa McAuliffe Commemorative Coin Act of 2016". Findings are also included in the Act. The Act, known as the "Christa McAuliffe Commemorative Coin Act of 2016," includes findings about Christa McAuliffe, a teacher selected for the Teacher in Space program who tragically died in the Space Shuttle Challenger disaster. The Act also mentions the founding of FIRST to inspire young people in science and technology. FIRST is a mentor-based program that inspires innovation and fosters life skills like self-confidence and leadership. Over 1,000,000 children from the US and 86 countries participate annually. Studies show that FIRST alumni are more likely to pursue careers in science and engineering and volunteer in their communities. The program is dedicated to continuing Christa McAuliffe's mission of inspiring students and creating a new generation of dreamers and innovators. 2016 marks the 30th anniversary of the Space Shuttle Challenger tragedy. The Secretary of the Treasury will mint $1 coins in honor of Christa McAuliffe, with specific specifications including weight, diameter, and silver content. These coins will be legal tender and considered numismatic items. The design of the coins minted under this Act will feature an image and the name of Christa McAuliffe on the obverse side, and a design on the reverse side depicting her legacy as a teacher. Each coin will also include a value designation, the year "2018", and inscriptions of "Liberty", "In God We Trust", "United States of America", and "E Pluribus Unum". The design will be selected by the Secretary in consultation with the family of Christa McAuliffe and FIRST. The design will be selected by the Secretary in consultation with the family of Christa McAuliffe and FIRST; and reviewed by the Citizens Coinage Advisory Committee. SEC. 5. ISSUANCE OF COINS. Coins minted under this Act will be issued in uncirculated and proof qualities at a single designated facility of the United States Mint. The Secretary is authorized to issue these coins only between January 1, 2018, and December 31, 2018. SEC. 6. SALE OF COINS. The coins issued under this Act will be sold by the Secretary at a price equal to the face value, surcharge, and cost of designing and issuing the coins. Bulk sales will be offered at a discount, and prepaid orders will be accepted with sale prices at a discount. The coins issued under this Act will be sold at face value, surcharge, and design cost. Prepaid orders will receive a reasonable discount. SEC. 7. SURCHARGES.

Sales of coins under this Act will include a $10 surcharge per coin, with all surcharge proceeds going to the FIRST robotics program to inspire young people in STEM fields. The program will be audited for accountability.

SEC. 8. FINANCIAL ASSURANCES. The Secretary must ensure that minting coins under this Act does not cost the Federal Government, and no funds are disbursed until all costs are recovered by the United States Treasury.
